main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported over Cleveland, Ohio in November 1957 with descriptions of round, blue-grey objects observed in the sky.
interesting points: The observed objects were described as circular, silver in color, and moving at a very high rate of speed.
One of the reported sightings described a round, blue-grey object the size of a basketball, making a clockwise motion and being observed for 5 minutes.
The report indicated that the sightings were likely reflections of searchlights from Cleveland off registered clouds, causing similar UFO reports at the time.
There were multiple observers of the UFO sightings, and the observed object was reported to have made a sharp descent and accelerated rapidly.
The report includes conflicting conclusions of the observed objects as a probable balloon, aircraft, astronomical, satellite, or unexplained.
